sentence.Network_en: "I am no apologist for Hitler," observed Pyat.
sentence.Network_cn: “我不是为希特勒辩护，”皮亚说。

sentence.Network_en: He has been cast in the role of chief apologist for the government.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被说成是政府的主要辩护者.

sentence.Network_en: He was also a philosopher, Christian apologist, playwright, and poet.
sentence.Network_cn: 他还是一位哲学家 、 护教家 、 剧作家和诗人.

RelatedPhrase.word: play the role of an apologist

list.key: play the role of an apologist

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French apologiste, from Greek apologizesthai 'give an account' (see apologize)

entry.def: An apologist is a person who writes or speaks in defence of a belief, a cause, or a person's life.

example.ex: 'I am no apologist for Hitler,' observed Pyat.
example.tran: “我不是为希特勒辩护，”皮亚说。
伟大的基督教辩护士奥利金

means.word_mean: 1. a person who argues to defend or justify some policy or institution;

auth_sentence.content: I am not an apologist for all skyscrapers.
auth_sentence.res_content: I am not an apologist for all skyscrapers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I am not an apologist for all skyscrapers.

auth_sentence.content: But Ketchum is an unpredictable apologist.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Ketchum is an unpredictable apologist.

auth_sentence.content: Further, he cites Dawkins an apologist for atheism totally discrediting his argument.
auth_sentence.res_content: Further, he cites Dawkins an apologist for atheism totally discrediting his argument.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Further, he cites Dawkins an apologist for atheism totally discrediting his argument.
